record.dc:title: 52BT20, 15BT20, Butler County, Kentucky. Annis Village. Structure 10, outline.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Mississippian Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Here is another example of a structure lying almost exactly on the compass, about 18' in length, 17' in width, with wall lines indicated by individual postmolds rather than walls. A fire basin (Feature 35), containing a deposit of ash, sits in the center. Stakes left standing on pillars are ten feet apart. The cut in the floor, at the rear, is not a feature, but an excavation to determine postmold depth. View from southeastward. See also photo 53.
